title: Triangle decompositions of PG(n,2)
authors: Minjia Shi, Xiaoxiao Li, Denis S. Krotov
abstract:
We define a triangle design as a partition of the set of $2$-dimensional
subspaces of an $n$-dimensional vector space into triangles, where a triangle
consists of three subspaces with the trivial, $0$-dimensional, intersection and
$1$-dimensional mutual intersections. A triangle design is balanced if all
nonzero vectors are involved in the same number of triangles. Over the binary
field GF$(2)$, we construct balanced triangle designs for all admissible $n$
(congruent to $1$ modulo $6$) and an infinite class of balanced block-divisible
triangle designs. We also prove that the existence of a triangle design over
GF$(2)$ invariant under the action of the Singer cycle group is equivalent to
the existence of a partition of $Z_{2^n-1}\backslash\{0\}$ into special
$18$-subsets and find such designs for $n=7$, $13$, $19$.
